chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant James M. Kropf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).
  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency (Felony), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

superMiscConds.notes: No use of computer/internet unless pre approved by agent. No unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18; defendant is allowed to have contact with daughter.  No contact with victim.

Psychosexual evaluation and follow up as deemed appropriate by the dept. Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
Comply w/ Sex offender registry.

Case Called: 10:01 am 
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence by Zoom Video; Deft appears by Zoom Audio, pro se. 
Date and time set for hrg on petition for sentence adjustment. 
COURT questions if petition is moot as deft release date is in less than 30 days. 
Deft notes his social worker has indicated release can happen sooner if petition is granted. 
State takes no position on petition. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT grants petition for sentence adjustment. 
COURT notes request to amend condition of ES re: use of computer. 
State requests matter be left up to the discretion of the agent. 
COURT denies motion and indicates order is at discretion of agent. 
COURT notes deft could petition again to amend condition if he encounters hardship.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 10:30 pm 
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Thomas Aquino. 
Date and time was set for hearing on def's motion for postconviction relief. 
State notes parties have reached agreement short of litigating motion. 
Atty Aquino notes history of matter and notes agreement of the parties. 
COURT vacates JOC as relates to Ct. 3 only. 
COURT allows amendment of Ct. 3 (Expose Child to Harmful Descriptions) to Ct. 3 (Felony Intent Contribute to deliquency of a child) pursuant to 948.40(1).  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

PLEA: Amended Ct. 3 (Felony Intent Contribute to Deliquency of a Child)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 3>>2 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 1 year ES - CONDITIONS OF ES>>same as previously ordered on Ct. 1. 
Atty Aquino requests amendment re: no contact condition of ES. 
No objection. 
COURT amends condition of no unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18 to allow contact with def's daughter.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:26 am 
State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon; Deft appears in person with Atty Dave Casey. 
COURT notes PSI. 
Parties they have reviewed PSI. Atty Casey notes 1 correction to PSI. 
VRCW. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: 
On Ct. 2>>12 years imprisonment - 4 years IC and 8 years ES 
On Ct. 3>>2 years imprisonment - 1 years IC and 1 years ES. 

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS OF ES>>psychosexual evaluation and follow through as deemed appropriate by the dept; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no use of computer/internet unless pre-approved by agent; no unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18; no contact with victim; comply with sex offender registry; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 

COURT ORDERS sentences to run CONCURRENT. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to NO days sentence credit. 
COURT finds the deft NOT eligible for CIP and SAP. 

COURT allows parties to retain copies of PSI and reminds them to maintain their confidentiality. 

COURT remands deft into custody of MCSD for transport to WSPS.

AMENDED.  No contact with victim(s):  S.A.P. (DOB: 6/03/1998) and no contact with juveniles under 18 years of age; except for 2 year old daughter. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  APPLYING TO 12/26/15 ONLY; Defendant is allowed to have contact with juveniles under the age of 18 as long as someone over the age of 25 is present at all times.

Modifying Bond Condition of No contact with juveniles under 18 years of age to allow contact with Juveniles under the age of 18 as long as someone over the age of 25 is present at all times and modification only applies to 12/26/2015.
